conclusion: Magnetic field B = 0.1 T in the positive x-direction
Coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis
In the initial position shown in the figure, the coil ABCO lies in the x-z plane. The normal to this coil is along the y-axis, which is perpendicular to the magnetic field (x-direction).

premise: The normal to the coil is perpendicular to the magnetic field.

conclusion: Initial magnetic flux Φ₁ = B * A * cos(90°) = 0.1 * 0.4 * 0 = 0 Wb

premise: After rotating 60° downward around the z-axis, the normal to the coil is no longer along the y-axis.
conclusion: The new angle between the normal and the magnetic field is θ₂ = 90° - 60° = 30°
Final magnetic flux Φ₂ = B * A * cos(30°) = 0.1 * 0.4 * 0.866 = 0.03464 Wb

premise: Final magnetic flux Φ₂ = 0.03464 Wb and initial magnetic flux Φ₁ = 0 Wb
conclusion: Change in flux ΔΦ = Φ₂ - Φ₁ = 0.03464 - 0 = 0.03464 Wb
The magnetic flux through the coil changes by 0.03464 Weber (Wb) when the coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
